crashes.viewStackTraceSubtitle: View the stack trace at the time of the crash

events.title: Crash Events
events.subtitle: View and analyze individual crash event occurrences

invitations.title: Invitation Management
invitations.subtitle: Manage user invitations
invitations.info: Invited users will join with regular user permissions. After sign-up, an administrator can change their role if needed.
invitations.emailOptionalHelp: If you leave the email empty, only a link will be generated.
invitations.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this invitation?
invitations.successDescription: New team members can now sign up to Gatrix using this link.
invitations.deleteConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this invitation link?
invitations.deleteConfirmWarning: Deleted invitation links cannot be recovered and the link will no longer be usable for registration.
invitations.invalidInviteSubtitle: The requested invitation link could not be found
invitations.invalidInviteMessage: This invitation link may have expired, already been used, or been deleted.
invitations.invalidInviteHelp: If you need a new invitation link, please contact an administrator.

remoteConfig.title: Remote Config
remoteConfig.subtitle: Manage remote application settings and update them in real-time
remoteConfig.deleteParameterConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this parameter
remoteConfig.deleteParameterWarning: This action cannot be undone. All campaigns and variants using this parameter may be affected.
remoteConfig.deleteCampaignConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this campaign
remoteConfig.helperCampaignName: Enter a unique name to identify this campaign.
remoteConfig.noParametersAvailable: No parameters available. Please add a parameter first.
remoteConfig.helperOverrideValue: Enter the new value to use during the campaign period.
remoteConfig.helperStartDate: The date when the campaign starts.
remoteConfig.helperEndDate: The date when the campaign ends.
remoteConfig.helperTrafficPercentage: Set the percentage of users exposed to this campaign. (1~100%)
remoteConfig.helperIsActive: Set whether the campaign is active.
remoteConfig.deleteContextFieldConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this context field
remoteConfig.deleteContextFieldWarning: This action cannot be undone. All segments using this field may be affected.
remoteConfig.deleteSegmentConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this segment
remoteConfig.deleteSegmentWarning: This action cannot be undone. All campaigns using this segment may be affected.
remoteConfig.deleteVariantConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this variant
remoteConfig.valueHelp: Enter true, false, 42, 'text', or JSON object
remoteConfig.weightHelp: Probability of this variant being selected (0-100%)
remoteConfig.confirmRollback: Are you sure you want to rollback to this version
remoteConfig.rollbackWarning: This will create a new deployment that restores the configuration from the selected version.

history.title: Remote Config History
history.subtitle: View deployment history and configuration change logs
history.confirmRollback: Are you sure you want to rollback to deployment "{deploymentName}"?

remoteConfig.createConfigSubtitle: Create a new remote configuration. Key names must start with a letter and contain only letters, numbers, and underscores.
remoteConfig.selectConfigsFirst: Please select configurations to stage first.
remoteConfig.stageDescriptionPlaceholder: Enter a description for this staging...
remoteConfig.deploymentDescriptionPlaceholder: Enter a description for this deployment...
remoteConfig.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete "{keyName}"?

helpTexts.keyName: Unique identifier for the configuration. Must start with a letter and contain only letters, numbers, and underscores. (e.g., userSettings, max_retry_count, API_KEY)
helpTexts.keyNameCreate: Unique identifier for the configuration. Cannot be changed after creation. Must start with a letter and contain only letters, numbers, and underscores.
helpTexts.keyNameEdit: Key name cannot be changed after creation.
helpTexts.parameterKey: Must start with a letter and contain only letters, numbers, underscores (_), and hyphens (-). (e.g., feature_flag, Enable-Dark-Mode)
helpTexts.parameterKeyEdit: Parameter key cannot be changed after creation.
helpTexts.valueType: Select the data type for the configuration value. JSON and YAML are used for storing complex structured data.
helpTexts.parameterType: Select the data type for the parameter value. You can choose from String, Number, Boolean, or JSON.
helpTexts.defaultValue: Enter the default value to be used by clients. Must match the selected value type format.
helpTexts.parameterDefaultValue: Enter the default value to be used by clients. Must match the selected type format.
helpTexts.description: Describe the purpose and usage of this configuration. Write clearly for other developers to understand.
helpTexts.parameterDescription: Describe the purpose and usage of this parameter. Write clearly for other developers to understand.

validation.keyNameInvalid: Key name must start with a letter and contain only letters, numbers, and underscores

variants.title: A/B Test Variants
variants.valueHelp: Enter the value to use for this variant.
variants.trafficHelp: Traffic percentage to allocate to this variant (0-100%)
variants.comingSoon: A/B test variant management features coming soon.

campaigns.title: Campaigns
campaigns.createCampaignSubtitle: Create a campaign to change configuration values for a specific period
campaigns.campaignNameHelp: Enter a unique name to identify this campaign
campaigns.startDateHelp: Set the date and time when the campaign will automatically start
campaigns.endDateHelp: Set the date and time when the campaign will automatically end
campaigns.targetConditionsHelp: Set conditions to apply only to specific user groups
campaigns.overrideConfigsHelp: Select configurations and values to change during the campaign period
campaigns.noConditionsSet: No conditions set. Campaign will apply to all users.

targeting.title: Targeting
targeting.name: Targeting Name
targeting.nameHelp: Enter a unique name to identify this targeting
targeting.descriptionHelp: Describe the purpose and usage of this targeting

contextFields.title: Context Fields
contextFields.createFieldSubtitle: Create context fields to use in campaign conditions
contextFields.keyHelp: Unique identifier for the field. Must start with a letter and contain only letters, numbers, and underscores.
contextFields.name: Field Name
contextFields.nameHelp: Display name for the field shown to users
contextFields.descriptionHelp: Describe the purpose and usage of this field
contextFields.deleteConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the '{{name}}' context field?

users.canOnlyModifyOwnName: You can only modify your own name
users.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this user?
users.deleteConfirmationInput: To confirm deletion, please type the user's email address:
users.bulkDeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete {{count}} users?
users.bulkTagsHelperText: Select tags to assign to users. Leave empty to remove all tags from selected users.
users.bulkStatusSubtitle: Bulk update the account status of selected users. You can choose from active, pending, or suspended status to apply to all selected users.
users.bulkRoleSubtitle: Bulk update the system roles of selected users. You can assign either regular user or administrator privileges to the selected users.
users.bulkEmailVerifiedSubtitle: Bulk update the email verification status of selected users. You can set them as verified or unverified status.
users.bulkTagsSubtitle: Bulk assign or remove tags from selected users. Tags can be used for user classification and management purposes.
users.bulkDeleteSubtitle: Permanently delete selected users from the system. This action cannot be undone, so please proceed with caution.
users.subtitle: Manage user accounts, roles, permissions, and monitor user activity across the system
users.title: User Management
users.addUserDialogDescription: Create a new user account and set permissions.
users.editUserDialogDescription: Modify existing user information and permissions.
users.verificationEmailError: Error occurred while sending verification email
users.name: Name
users.tagsHelp: Select tags to classify and manage users.
users.allowAllEnvironmentsWarning: A user with access to all environments can affect production environments. It is recommended to select only the environments you need.
users.selectEnvironmentsHelp: Select the environments this user can access. If none are selected, the user cannot access any environment.
users.selectPermissionsDesc: Select the permissions to grant to the admin. Without any permissions, the admin cannot access the admin pages.
users.noPermissionsForUser: Regular users do not have admin permissions.
users.noEnvironmentAccessForUser: Regular users cannot access environments. Promote to admin to configure environment access.
users.reviewChangesDesc: The following changes will be applied. Please review and save.

permissions.users_view_desc: View the list of registered users and check user information. Includes user search, filtering, and detailed information viewing.
permissions.users_manage_desc: Add, edit, delete users and change roles and permissions. Includes admin promotion/demotion and password reset.
permissions.client-versions_view_desc: View the list of game client versions and check the status of each version (required update, recommended update, etc.).
permissions.client-versions_manage_desc: Add, edit, delete client versions and set update policies. Manage forced update settings and maintenance messages per version.
permissions.game-worlds_view_desc: View the list of game servers (worlds) and check the status, connection info, and maintenance status of each world.
permissions.game-worlds_manage_desc: Add, edit, delete game worlds and set maintenance mode. Includes world order changes and visibility settings.
permissions.maintenance_view_desc: View ongoing and scheduled maintenance. Check maintenance history and status.
permissions.maintenance_manage_desc: Start, end maintenance and schedule maintenance. Set maintenance messages and target scope.
permissions.maintenance-templates_view_desc: View the list of frequently used maintenance message templates.
permissions.maintenance-templates_manage_desc: Add, edit, delete maintenance message templates. Manage multilingual message templates.
permissions.scheduler_view_desc: View the list of scheduled tasks (maintenance, notices, etc.) and check execution history.
permissions.scheduler_manage_desc: Add, edit, delete scheduled tasks and manage execution schedules. Includes recurring task settings.
permissions.audit-logs_view_desc: View the history of all administrative actions in the system. Track who performed what action and when.
permissions.realtime-events_view_desc: View real-time event logs from game servers. Monitor user activities and system events.
permissions.crash-events_view_desc: View and analyze crash reports from game clients. Identify error patterns and impact scope.
permissions.remote-config_view_desc: View remote configuration values applied to game clients. Compare settings across environments.
permissions.remote-config_manage_desc: Add, edit, delete remote configuration values and deploy to environments. Manage change requests and approval process.
permissions.security_view_desc: View security settings such as IP block lists and access control rules.
permissions.security_manage_desc: Add, edit, delete IP blocks and access control rules. Set and manage security policies.
permissions.servers_view_desc: View the list of registered game servers and their connection status.
permissions.servers_manage_desc: Register, edit, delete game servers and manage connection settings.
permissions.monitoring_view_desc: View monitoring dashboard including system status, performance metrics, and resource usage.
permissions.open-api_view_desc: View Open API documentation and API keys for external integrations.
permissions.console_access_desc: Access the developer console to execute advanced commands. Use system diagnostics and debugging tools.
permissions.service-notices_view_desc: View the list of in-game service notices. Check notice content, posting period, and target audience.
permissions.service-notices_manage_desc: Create, edit, delete service notices and manage posting schedules. Includes multilingual notice creation.
permissions.ingame-popup-notices_view_desc: View the list of notices displayed as popups in the game.
permissions.ingame-popup-notices_manage_desc: Create, edit, delete in-game popup notices and set display conditions. Manage images and button actions.
permissions.coupons_view_desc: View the list of issued coupons and usage status. Check coupon codes, rewards, and validity periods.
permissions.coupons_manage_desc: Create, edit, delete coupons and set issuance conditions. Includes bulk coupon generation and usage restrictions.
permissions.surveys_view_desc: View the list of in-game surveys and response results.
permissions.surveys_manage_desc: Create, edit, delete surveys and set target users. Includes survey result analysis.
permissions.operation-events_view_desc: View the list of in-game operation events (attendance, missions, etc.).
permissions.operation-events_manage_desc: Create, edit, delete operation events and set rewards and conditions.
permissions.store-products_view_desc: View the list of products available in the in-game store.
permissions.store-products_manage_desc: Manage the sale status and settings of store products.
permissions.reward-templates_view_desc: View the list of frequently used reward configuration templates.
permissions.reward-templates_manage_desc: Add, edit, delete reward templates. Manage reward configurations including items and currencies.
permissions.banners_view_desc: View the list of in-game banner images and display settings.
permissions.banners_manage_desc: Add, edit, delete banners and set display order, links, and periods.
permissions.planning-data_view_desc: View the list of game planning data (items, skills, monsters, etc.).
permissions.planning-data_manage_desc: Upload, edit, delete planning data and manage versions.
permissions.event-lens_view_desc: View and analyze game event data in the Event Lens dashboard.
permissions.event-lens_manage_desc: Change Event Lens settings and configure custom dashboards.
permissions.tags_view_desc: View the list of tags used in the system. Tags are used for content classification and filtering.
permissions.tags_manage_desc: Add, edit, delete tags. Manage tag colors and descriptions.
permissions.data-management_view_desc: View system data backup and export status.
permissions.data-management_manage_desc: Perform data backup, restore, export, and import operations.
permissions.environments_view_desc: View the list of environments (development, staging, production) and their settings.
permissions.environments_manage_desc: Add, edit, delete environments and manage environment-specific settings.
permissions.system-settings_view_desc: View system settings including network, integrations, service discovery, and key-value configurations.
permissions.system-settings_manage_desc: Modify and save system settings. Manage network URLs, webhooks, service discovery settings, and more.

gameWorlds.name: Name
gameWorlds.alreadyBottom: Game world is already at the bottom
gameWorlds.alreadyTop: Game world is already at the top
gameWorlds.creator: Creator

form.descriptionHelp: Enter a brief description of this world
form.maintenanceHelp: If maintenance is on, users cannot enter this world
form.nameHelp: This name will be displayed to users (automatically copied from World ID when typing)
form.visibleHelp: Choose whether to show this world to users
form.worldServerAddressHelp: Enter the world server address that clients will connect to (domain, IP, or host:port, e.g., world.example.com, 192.168.1.100:8080)
form.worldServerAddressInvalid: World server address must be a valid domain, IP, or host:port (e.g., world.example.com, 192.168.1.100:8080)
form.customPayloadHelp: Additional game world data in JSON format. Leave empty to save as {}.
form.addDescription: Create a new game world and configure server settings and connection information.
form.editDescription: Modify existing game world settings and update configurations.
form.infraSettingsHelp: Enter game server infrastructure settings in JSON5 format. Supports comments (//) and trailing commas. These settings are passed to game servers via SDK.
form.switchToBasicInfoToSave: Switch to Basic Info tab to save.

gameWorlds.noWorldsDesc: Create your first game world to get started
gameWorlds.searchPlaceholder: Search by name, world ID, or description...
gameWorlds.title: Game Worlds Management
gameWorlds.subtitle: Create and edit game worlds, manage visibility and maintenance state, and configure descriptions and tags.
gameWorlds.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete the "{{name}}" game world?
gameWorlds.deleteTypeToConfirm: To confirm deletion, please type the game world name:
gameWorlds.confirmHide: Are you sure you want to hide the "{{name}}" game world?
gameWorlds.confirmShow: Are you sure you want to show the "{{name}}" game world?
gameWorlds.confirmStartMaintenance: Are you sure you want to start maintenance for the "{{name}}" game world?
gameWorlds.confirmEndMaintenance: Are you sure you want to end maintenance for the "{{name}}" game world?

maintenanceConfig.title: Maintenance Settings
maintenanceConfig.startDateHelp: Select maintenance start date and time (optional). If left empty, maintenance will start immediately.
maintenanceConfig.endDateHelp: Select maintenance end date and time (optional). If left empty, maintenance will continue until manually ended.
maintenanceConfig.defaultMessageHelp: Enter the default maintenance message for all languages
maintenanceConfig.supportsMultiLanguageHelp: Enable different maintenance messages for each language
maintenanceConfig.messageRequired: Default maintenance message is required when maintenance mode is enabled
maintenanceConfig.translateTooltip: Automatically translate the default maintenance message to multiple languages
maintenanceConfig.validationMinDuration: Maintenance duration must be at least 5 minutes. (Current: {{duration}} min)
maintenanceConfig.validationGracePeriodExceedsDuration: Grace period must be shorter than maintenance duration. (Duration: {{duration}} min, Grace period: {{gracePeriod}} min)

sdkGuide.title: Server SDK Integration Guide
sdkGuide.subtitle: Learn how to retrieve the game worlds list using the Server Side SDK API.
sdkGuide.description: You can retrieve all active game worlds list using the Server Side SDK API. This guide explains the required authentication information, API endpoint, and request/response format.
sdkGuide.noParameters: This API has no required parameters. It retrieves all active game worlds sorted by displayOrder in ascending order (lower values first).
sdkGuide.optionalParameters: Optional parameter: lang (specify the language for maintenance messages, default: language-agnostic default message)
sdkGuide.errorCodesDesc: Error response examples for various scenarios.
sdkGuide.headerApiToken: Server API Token (included in X-API-Token header)
sdkGuide.missingHeadersDesc: X-API-Token or X-Application-Name header is missing.
sdkGuide.unauthorizedDesc: The provided API token is invalid.
sdkGuide.internalErrorDesc: An error occurred while retrieving the game worlds list.
sdkGuide.fieldMaintenanceMessage: Message displayed when in maintenance mode (included only when isMaintenance is true)
sdkGuide.fieldTags: List of tags assigned to the game world
sdkGuide.fieldWorldIdDesc: Unique identifier of the game world
sdkGuide.fieldIsMaintenanceDesc: Whether the game world is under maintenance (true/false)
sdkGuide.fieldMaintenanceMessageDesc: Maintenance message (included only when isMaintenance is true)
sdkGuide.fieldWorldServerAddressDesc: Game world server address (domain, IP, or host:port format, e.g., world.example.com, 192.168.1.100:8080)
sdkGuide.fieldCustomPayloadDesc: Custom data of the game world (JSON object)
sdkGuide.fieldTagsDesc: Array of tag names assigned to the game world
sdkGuide.langParameter: lang parameter (optional): Specifies the language for maintenance messages. Supported languages are ko, en, zh. If not specified, the default message (language-agnostic) is returned.
sdkGuide.maintenanceMessageNote: When isMaintenance is true, the maintenanceMessage field is included in the response. If the lang parameter is specified, the message in that language is returned; if not specified, the default message is returned.
sdkGuide.maintenanceTimingNote: Maintenance timing field behavior: If the maintenance start time is null, maintenance starts immediately. If the maintenance end time is null, maintenance continues until manually ended. If the maintenance end time is specified and the current time has passed the end time, isMaintenance is automatically returned as false.
sdkGuide.testLangHelp: Specifies the language for maintenance messages. Supported: ko, en, zh. If left empty, the default message is returned.

messageTemplates.title: Message Templates
messageTemplates.subtitle: Manage message templates used by the system
messageTemplates.name: Name
messageTemplates.searchPlaceholderDetailed: Search by template name, type, or message content...
messageTemplates.editDescription: Edit an existing message template and manage multi-language messages.
messageTemplates.addDescription: Create a new message template and configure multi-language messages.
messageTemplates.defaultMessageHelp: Default message displayed when no specific language is specified
messageTemplates.supportsMultiLanguageHelp: Enable different messages for each language
messageTemplates.translateTooltip: Automatically translate the default message to other languages
messageTemplates.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete message template '{{name}}'?
messageTemplates.confirmBulkDelete: Are you sure you want to delete {{count}} selected message templates?
messageTemplates.bulkDeleteFailed: Failed to bulk delete message templates
messageTemplates.bulkUpdateSuccess: {{count}} message templates have been changed to {{status}}
messageTemplates.bulkUpdateFailed: Failed to bulk update message templates

errors.duplicateName: A message template with this name already exists

maintenance.description: Set the maintenance period and message.
maintenance.impactWarningTitle: Impact when starting game service maintenance
maintenance.impactWarningDescription: Starting game service maintenance will have the following impact:
maintenance.impactItem1: All players will be disconnected from the game immediately
maintenance.impactItem2: Ongoing game sessions will be forcibly terminated and may result in data loss
maintenance.impactItem3: A maintenance notice will be shown on the game client
maintenance.impactItem4: Game access and new logins will be blocked until maintenance ends
maintenance.impactRestoreTitle: Restoration when ending game service maintenance
maintenance.impactRestoreDescription: Ending game service maintenance will restore the following:
maintenance.restoreItem1: All players can access the game normally
maintenance.restoreItem2: New game sessions can be started
maintenance.restoreItem3: Maintenance messages disappear and normal service resumes
maintenance.impactItemKick1: All players will be forcibly disconnected after the specified delay
maintenance.impactItemKick2: Ongoing sessions will be forcibly ended and may cause data loss
maintenance.impactItemKick3: A maintenance notice will be shown to players
maintenance.impactItemKick4: Access and new logins will be blocked until maintenance ends
maintenance.impactItemNoKick1: New player access will be blocked
maintenance.impactItemNoKick2: Currently connected players can continue playing
maintenance.impactItemNoKick3: A scheduled maintenance notice will be shown
maintenance.impactItemNoKick4: Only new logins are blocked until maintenance ends
maintenance.typeHelp: Regular: planned server updates or routine maintenance / Emergency: bug fixes or urgent response
maintenance.startsAtHelp: Leave empty to start immediately. If set to a future time, maintenance will start automatically then.
maintenance.endsAtHelp: Leave empty to stop manually. If set, maintenance will end automatically then.
maintenance.kickExistingPlayersHelp: When enabled: disconnect all connected players when maintenance starts. When disabled: allow current players to continue, only block new connections.
maintenance.kickDelayHelp: Time to wait after showing the maintenance message before disconnecting players
maintenance.messageSourceHelp: Direct Input: write the maintenance message yourself. Use Template: select a predefined message template.
maintenance.selectTemplateHelp: Select the message template to use. Templates include a default message and multi-language messages.

validation.startTimeInPast: Start time is in the past. Maintenance will start immediately.
validation.endTimeInPast: End time is in the past. Maintenance will end immediately.
validation.endTimeBeforeStart: End time is earlier than start time. Please set a correct time.
validation.sameStartEndTime: Start and end times are the same. Maintenance may end immediately.

maintenance.startFailedWarning: Failed to start maintenance. Please check time settings. If the end time is in the past or earlier than the start time, maintenance may end immediately.
maintenance.confirmStartSubtitle: Before starting maintenance, review the settings below and consider the impact.
maintenance.confirmStopSubtitle: Stopping maintenance will restore normal service. Continue?
maintenance.confirmUpdateSubtitle: Do you want to update the maintenance settings?
maintenance.confirmUpdateMessage: To confirm the update, please type "{{keyword}}".
maintenance.validationTimeInPast: Start time is in the past. Please set a future time.
maintenance.validationEndTimeInPast: End time is in the past. Please set a future time.
maintenance.validationEndBeforeStart: End time is earlier than start time.
maintenance.validationTooShort: Maintenance time is too short. Please set at least 5 minutes.
maintenance.validationMinDuration: Maintenance duration must be at least 5 minutes. (Current: {{duration}} min)
maintenance.validationGracePeriodExceedsDuration: Grace period must be shorter than maintenance duration. (Duration: {{duration}} min, Grace period: {{gracePeriod}} min)
maintenance.title: Maintenance Settings
maintenance.supportsMultiLanguageHelp: Enable to set different maintenance messages for each language
maintenance.translateTooltip: Automatically translate the default maintenance message to other languages
maintenance.startDateHelp: If left empty, maintenance starts immediately. If set, maintenance starts automatically at the specified time.
maintenance.endDateHelp: If left empty, maintenance continues until manually stopped. If set, maintenance ends automatically at the specified time.
maintenance.defaultMessageHelp: Enter the default maintenance message to be used in all languages

scheduler.title: Schedule Management
scheduler.subtitle: Create, manage, and monitor scheduled tasks, automated jobs, and recurring system operations
scheduler.cronHelp: Enter cron expression (e.g., 0 0 12 * * ? = daily at noon)
scheduler.cronExamples: Examples: 0 0 9 * * MON-FRI (weekdays at 9 AM), 0 0 0 1 * ? (1st of every month at midnight)
scheduler.endTimeAfterStart: End time must be after execution time
scheduler.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete the "{{name}}" scheduled task?

whitelist.title: Whitelist
whitelist.subtitle: Manage account and IP-based access control with whitelist entries, permissions, and security policies

overview.title: Whitelist Overview
overview.testDescription: Enter account ID and IP address to check whitelist application status.
overview.testWarning: Please enter either an account ID or IP address.

dialog.addDescription: Add a new account to the whitelist and configure access permissions.
dialog.editDescription: Modify the information of an existing whitelist entry.
dialog.bulkHint1: Enter one entry per line in the format: Account ID [Tab] IP Address [Tab] Memo [Tab] Tags
dialog.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this account whitelist entry?

form.accountIdValidation: Account ID must be between 4-36 characters.
form.accountIdHelp: Please enter the exact account ID of the user to add to the whitelist. (4-36 characters)
form.purposePlaceholder: Enter the purpose for adding to whitelist
form.purposeHelp: Please record the reason or purpose for adding to the whitelist. This helps with management and tracking.
form.ipHelp: Enter an IP address to allow access only from that IP. Leave empty to allow access from any IP.
form.startDateHelp: Select the start date when the whitelist will be activated. Leave empty for immediate activation.
form.endDateHelp: Select the expiration date for the whitelist. Leave empty for permanent access.

whitelist.searchPlaceholder: Search by account ID, IP address, memo, or tags...

apiTokens.title: API Access Tokens
apiTokens.subtitle: Manage API access tokens for external integrations and services
apiTokens.createTokenSubtitle: Create a new API access token. Configure token type and environment access permissions.
apiTokens.editTokenSubtitle: Modify token settings. The token value will not change.
apiTokens.tokenNameHelp: Enter a descriptive name for this token
apiTokens.tokenNameMinLength: Token name must be at least 3 characters
apiTokens.edgeTokenDescription: Token for client to edge server access
apiTokens.edgeTokenNote: Note: Edge tokens can only be used with a single environment. Select the target environment below.
apiTokens.allTokenDescription: Token that can access both client and server APIs
apiTokens.allTokenWarning: Warning: This token can access both client and server APIs, which may pose a higher security risk. Use only in trusted environments such as internal system integrations.
apiTokens.tokenTypeNotEditable: Token type cannot be changed after creation
apiTokens.searchPlaceholder: Search by token name, description, or type...
apiTokens.expiresAtPastError: Expiration date cannot be in the past.
apiTokens.expiresAtTooSoonError: Expiration date must be at least 5 minutes from now.
apiTokens.tokenWarning: Please copy this token now. You won't be able to see it again!
apiTokens.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this API token? This action cannot be undone.
apiTokens.regenerateWarning: This will generate a new token value. The old token will become invalid immediately.
apiTokens.regenerateConfirmation: Are you sure you want to regenerate this API token?
apiTokens.regenerateConfirmInstruction: To confirm regeneration, please type the token name:
apiTokens.tokenSecurityNotice: For security reasons, this token value cannot be viewed again. Please copy it now and store it in a safe place.
apiTokens.deleteWarning: This action cannot be undone. The token will be permanently deleted.
apiTokens.deleteConfirmInstruction: To confirm deletion, please type the token name:
apiTokens.deleteConfirmMismatch: Token name does not match. Please type the exact token name to confirm deletion.
apiTokens.tokenAvailable: You can copy this token anytime from the token list or regenerate it if needed.
apiTokens.tokenValueError: Failed to retrieve token value. Please try again.
apiTokens.bulkDeleteWarning: This action cannot be undone. The following tokens will be permanently deleted:
apiTokens.bulkDeleteConfirmMismatch: Confirmation text does not match. Please type the exact text above.
apiTokens.allowAllEnvironmentsDescription: This token can access all environments
apiTokens.allowAllEnvironmentsWarning: A token with access to all environments can affect production environments. It is recommended to select only the environments you need.
apiTokens.selectSingleEnvironment: Select the target environment for this Edge token:

auditLogs.noLogsDesc: No audit logs match your current filters
auditLogs.subtitle: Track and monitor all system activities, user actions, and administrative operations with detailed audit trails
auditLogs.title: Audit Logs

auth.joinDescription: Integrated management platform supporting essential features for online gaming services
auth.welcomeDescription: Integrated management platform supporting essential features for online gaming services
auth.checkEmailForReset: Check your email to reset your password.
auth.emailHelp: Enter a valid email address for login and notifications
auth.passwordHelp: Enter a secure password with at least 6 characters
auth.confirmPasswordHelp: Re-enter the same password as above
auth.emailInvalid: Please enter a valid email address
auth.emailNotRegistered: We couldn't find an account with that email address
auth.emailSendFailed: Failed to send email. Please try again later.
auth.enterEmailToReset: Enter your email address to reset your password

sessionExpired.title: Session Expired
sessionExpired.description: Your login information is no longer valid. Please log in again.
sessionExpired.reason: The server may have been reset or your account may have been deleted. If the problem persists, please contact the administrator.

errors.authenticationFailed: Authentication failed. Please check your email and password.

auth.signUpDescription: Join now and unlock all features

features.title: Powerful Features
features.maintenanceControl: Scheduled maintenance with instant player notifications

about.heroSubtitle: Those repetitive ops tasks? Let GATRIX handle them.
about.heroDescription: Maintenance alerts, version control, announcements... Tired of doing it all manually? We've got you.
about.whyGatrix: This might be for you if...
about.whyDescription: Ever felt annoyed by live service ops? Yeah, us too.
about.benefit1Description: Starting, ending, extending... Tired of announcing everything manually? Just set it up once and we'll handle the rest.
about.benefit2Description: iOS is 1.2.3, Android is 1.2.4, PC is... confusing, right? We keep it organized by platform.
about.benefit3Description: We might not be perfect yet. But we're constantly getting better, so let's grow together.
about.featuresDescription: Tools to make your daily ops tasks easier
about.feature1Description: Live dashboards with server health, player counts, and performance metrics. Know exactly what's happening at all times.
about.feature2Description: Schedule maintenance windows, set notifications, and control access. Seamless updates without player frustration.
about.feature3Description: Multi-platform client version control with forced update options. Ensure all players are on the right version.
about.feature4Description: In-game announcements, popups, and event banners. Reach your players where they are.
about.feature5Description: Bulk mailing with item attachments. Perfect for events, compensation, and player engagement.
about.feature6Description: Flexible coupon generation with usage limits and expiration. Drive promotions and measure results.
about.ctaTitle: Want to give it a try?
about.ctaDescription: It's free to start. If it makes life easier, keep using it.

clientVersions.description: Add and edit client versions by platform, manage game server and patch server addresses, and control update policies.
clientVersions.bulkCreateSuccess: {{count}} client versions have been created successfully.
clientVersions.versionTooOld: The version ({{newVersion}}) is lower than the current latest version ({{latestVersion}}). Only versions higher than the latest can be registered.
clientVersions.versionTooOldBulk: The version is lower than the latest version for some platforms: {{platforms}}. Only versions higher than the latest can be registered.
clientVersions.duplicateClientVersions: Duplicate client versions found: {{duplicates}}. The same platform and version combination cannot be registered multiple times in the same environment.
clientVersions.deleteConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this client version?
clientVersions.bulkDeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete {{count}} selected client versions?

form.additionalSettingsDescription: Manage additional settings such as guest mode, external links, and memos.
form.basicInfoDescription: Enter basic identification information for the client version.
form.bulkBasicInfoDescription: Enter basic information that will be applied to all platforms.
form.bulkDescription: You can create client versions for multiple platforms simultaneously with a single version.
form.bulkPlatformHelp: Select platforms to create client versions for. A separate version will be created for each selected platform.
form.bulkTagsHelp: Select tags to apply to all client versions that will be created.
form.platformSpecificDescription: Configure server addresses for each selected platform.
form.copyDescription: You can create a new version by copying an existing client version.
form.createDescription: You can create a new client version and configure game server and patch settings.
form.customPayloadHelp: Enter custom payload to be passed to the game. (JSON format, maximum 5000 characters)
form.editDescription: You can modify and update the settings of an existing client version.
form.externalClickLinkHelp: Specify external links that can be clicked in the game. (https://uwo.com, ...)
form.gameServerAddressForWhiteListHelp: Specify the game server address that only whitelisted users can access. (https://auth.uwo.com, ...)
form.gameServerAddressHelp: Specify the server address that the game will connect to. (https://auth.uwo.com, ...)
form.guestModeAllowedHelp: Specify whether to allow guest mode for the game.
form.memoHelp: Enter a memo about the game. (Maximum 1000 characters)
form.patchAddressForWhiteListHelp: Specify the patch server address that only whitelisted users can access. (https://patch.uwo.com/cdn, ...)
form.patchAddressHelp: Specify the server address that the game will patch from. (https://patch.uwo.com/cdn, ...)
form.platformHelp: Select the target platform (pc, pc-wegame, ios, android, harmonyos)
form.selectAtLeastOnePlatform: Please select at least one platform
form.serverAddressesDescription: Configure game server and patch server addresses.
form.statusHelp: Specify the status of the game. (Online, Offline, Recommended Update, Forced Update, Under Review, Blocked & Patch Allowed, Maintenance)
form.tagsHelp: Select tags to apply to this client version.
form.title: Client Version
form.versionHelp: Use Semantic Versioning (SemVer) format. Examples: 1.0.0, 2.1.3, 1.0.0-beta.1 (major.minor.patch or major.minor.patch-prerelease)

clientVersions.noVersionsDesc: Create your first client version to get started
clientVersions.searchHelperText: Search by platform, version, server address, patch address, or creator name
clientVersions.searchPlaceholder: Search by platform, version, server address, creator...
clientVersions.title: Client Version Management

maintenance.title: Maintenance Settings
maintenance.startDateHelp: Select maintenance start date and time (optional). If left empty, maintenance will start immediately.
maintenance.endDateHelp: Select maintenance end date and time (optional). If left empty, maintenance will continue until manually ended.
maintenance.defaultMessageHelp: Enter the default maintenance message for all languages
maintenance.supportsMultiLanguageHelp: Enable different maintenance messages for each language
maintenance.messageRequired: Default maintenance message is required when status is maintenance

sdkGuideDrawer.title: Client Version Query API
sdkGuideDrawer.subtitle: Learn how to query your client version information from your client application.
sdkGuideDrawer.description: Your client application can query detailed version information based on platform, client version, and environment. The response includes game server address, patch server address, guest mode availability, and additional metadata from key-value settings.
sdkGuideDrawer.paramPlatform: Platform where the client is running (required, e.g., ios, android, pc)
sdkGuideDrawer.paramClientVersion: Current version of the client (optional, e.g., 1.0.0). If omitted, retrieves the latest version for the platform.
sdkGuideDrawer.paramStatus: Status filter (optional, e.g., ONLINE, MAINTENANCE). When fetching latest version, only versions with this status are considered.
sdkGuideDrawer.paramLang: Language for maintenance message (optional, e.g., ko, en, zh)
sdkGuideDrawer.responseDescription: The response includes game server address, patch server address, guest mode availability, status, and additional metadata managed in key-value settings.
sdkGuideDrawer.responseStatusDesc: Status of the client version. All statuses return 200 OK, and the client should display appropriate UI based on the status.
sdkGuideDrawer.statusOnlineAction: The client can play the game normally.
sdkGuideDrawer.statusMaintenance: Server is under maintenance. The maintenanceMessage field contains the maintenance message, and guestModeAllowed is set to false.
sdkGuideDrawer.statusMaintenanceAction: Display maintenance message and block gameplay.
sdkGuideDrawer.statusRecommendedUpdateAction: Display 'New version available' message with an update button.
sdkGuideDrawer.statusForcedUpdateAction: Display 'Mandatory update' message and force the update.
sdkGuideDrawer.maintenanceResponseDesc: When status is MAINTENANCE, the maintenanceMessage field contains the maintenance message, and guestModeAllowed is set to false.
sdkGuideDrawer.errorResponsesDesc: Response examples for various error scenarios.
sdkGuideDrawer.whitelistNote: If the request is from a whitelisted IP address, the whitelist server addresses (gameServerAddressForWhiteList, patchAddressForWhiteList) will be returned if configured.

sdkGuideDrawer.title: Ingame Popup Notice Retrieval API
sdkGuideDrawer.subtitle: Learn how to retrieve active ingame popup notices from your game server.
sdkGuideDrawer.description: Your game server can retrieve a list of currently active and visible ingame popup notices. Each notice includes a priority value, and priority handling is managed by the game client.
sdkGuideDrawer.noParameters: This API has no required parameters. It retrieves all active and currently visible popup notices.
sdkGuideDrawer.headerAppName: Game server name (included in X-Application-Name header)
sdkGuideDrawer.headerApiToken: Server SDK API token (included in X-API-Token header)
sdkGuideDrawer.responseDescription: The response contains a list of active and currently visible popup notices.
sdkGuideDrawer.errorResponsesDesc: Response examples for various error scenarios.

couponSettings.subtitle: Define coupon settings, targeting, and limits.

sdkGuideDrawer.subtitle: Learn how to call the Coupon Redeem API from your client.
sdkGuideDrawer.description: Call the following API to redeem a coupon code and receive rewards.
sdkGuideDrawer.headerAppName: Identifier of the application sending the request
sdkGuideDrawer.error400: Missing required parameters or invalid request
sdkGuideDrawer.error422: Coupon period expired, targeting conditions not met, or input validation failed
sdkGuideDrawer.error429: Too many requests for the same user/code (spam limit)
sdkGuideDrawer.errorCodesDesc: Response examples for various error scenarios.

form.name: Name
form.codePatternHelp: Select the pattern for generating coupon codes.
form.codePatternCannotBeChanged: Code pattern cannot be changed after creation.
form.usageLimitTypeHelp: Select whether to limit coupon usage per user or per character.
form.perUserLimitHelp: Number of times each user can use this coupon.
form.perCharacterLimitHelp: Number of times each character can use this coupon.
form.descriptionHelp: Provide a brief description for this coupon.
form.codeHelp: Enter a coupon code. (Uppercase letters A-Z and numbers 0-9 only)
form.typeCannotBeChanged: Coupon type cannot be changed after creation.
form.maxTotalUsesHelp: Total usage limit across all users. Set to unlimited if not restricted.
form.startsAtHelp: Select when the coupon becomes valid. (Optional) If left empty, the coupon is immediately available.
form.quantityHelp: Enter the number of coupons to generate.
form.codeFormatError: Coupon code can only contain uppercase letters (A-Z) and numbers (0-9).
form.rewardEmailTitlePlaceholder: Example: Congratulations! You have received a coupon reward.
form.rewardEmailTitleHelp: Enter the subject line for the reward email.
form.rewardEmailBodyPlaceholder: Example: Congratulations! You have received a reward by using the coupon. Please check it in the game.
form.rewardEmailBodyHelp: Enter the body content for the reward email.
form.targetPlatformsHelp: Select platforms where the coupon applies (multiple selection available, all if not selected)
form.targetChannelsHelp: Select channels where the coupon applies (multiple selection available, all if not selected)
form.targetSubchannelsHelp: Select subchannels where the coupon applies (multiple selection available, all if not selected)
form.targetWorldsHelp: Select game worlds where the coupon applies (multiple selection available, all if not selected)
form.targetUserIdsHelp: Enter user IDs that can use the coupon (separated by line breaks, all if not entered)
form.statusHelp: Set whether the coupon is usable. When disabled, users cannot use the coupon.

statusTooltip.initializing: The server is starting up and loading configuration. It will automatically transition to 'Online' when ready.
statusTooltip.ready: The server is running normally and accepting connections.
statusTooltip.shuttingDown: The server is in the process of graceful shutdown. New connections may be refused.
statusTooltip.error: The server encountered an error and may not be functioning correctly. Check the server logs for details.
statusTooltip.terminated: The server has been shut down or has stopped. This is the final state.
statusTooltip.noResponse: The server has not sent a heartbeat within the expected interval. It may be unresponsive or experiencing network issues.
statusTooltip.busy: The server is currently busy processing requests.

openApi.description: Select and view the API documentation. Each API is used for different purposes.
openApi.info: Admin API is used in the admin panel, while Server SDK API and Client SDK API are used in game servers and clients respectively.
openApi.adminDescription: API used in the admin panel. Requires admin privileges and is authenticated via JWT token.
openApi.serverSdkDescription: API used in game servers. Authenticated via X-API-Token header and provides information about active game worlds.
openApi.clientSdkDescription: API used in game clients. Authenticated via X-API-Token header and provides client configuration information.

Download a full backup of the system dat: Download a full backup of the system data
This will export all database tables, pl: This will export all database tables, planning data files, and uploads into a single ZIP file.
